serverPackage

Class ClientHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • serverPackage.ClientHandler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class ClientHandler
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
    This class implements the interface Runnable for interacting with server. An instance of the class is a thread in server. The server can manage multiple thread with this class.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private static java.lang.String END_MARK
      When server receives message exit, client quits and this socket is closed.
      private java.lang.String nickname
      Nickname of current client.
      private java.net.Socket socket
      The socket which is handled by current thread.

      void run()
      When an object implementing interface Runnable is used to create a thread, starting the thread causes the object's run method to be called in that separately executing thread.

      • run

        public void run()
        Description copied from interface: java.lang.Runnable
        When an object implementing interface Runnable is used to create a thread, starting the thread causes the object's run method to be called in that separately executing thread.

        The general contract of the method run is that it may take any action whatsoever.

        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
        See Also:
        Runnable.run()
